content.description: On the west side of the island, next to an easy access ramp into the lake, there is an aesthetic cliff that is slightly overhanging. Grades are hard when you are wet and holds are wet. Water is deep enough to take a fall (5 feet and deeper). The right line starts with right hand on a good pinch and left hand on a crimp. Move out right to a sidepull and up. The left line starts anywhere on a long crimp rail. Climb up small crimps, or make a big, and very fun, move to the lip. For summer days, lots of variations here. This is near the Pinnacle Boulder.

climbs.name: West Side Deep Water - Roof Route - “No Swimming”

content.description: Fun line up a cool overhang feature. This one is borderline deep enough. Shallowest spot is about 40 inches. Need to have good awareness how you fall, or don't fall.
Start on head height edge, get a high foot, and make a few easy but fun moves to top.
content.location: This boulder is wedged between Joe’s Roof and the highball slab boulder.

content.description: Nice finger crack
content.protection: no protection for this one because it is over a bad water landing

content.description: After finishing on the prow ledge, cruise the off width crack to top.
content.location: Above the prow

content.description: After gaining the prow ledge, take the crack to the left of the offwidth.
content.location: Left of Sunshine Offwidth

content.description: Start same as Steep Arete - Traverse but head slightly to right and up. Top out.
content.location: North end of island. In the middle. Locate from photo.

content.description: Start on the large ledge that has a decent little incut for the left hand. Follow the edge of the arete to the peak and top out.
content.location: Located roughly in the middle of the boulder boulders on the north end. Should be able to locate from the photo below

content.description: Follow thin face to ledge above.
content.location: In the jumble by Joe’s Roof

content.description: There are alot of routes on this rock. one up the pinacle two cracks behind the pinacle and two faces

To the left of the Pinnacle Boulder is a clean granite face. There are 2-3 unique lines on the face. On the left, is the hardest line. Start on a good ledge and make big move to jug. Move up and top out from there. In the middle, with a stand start, climb up staying left of flake. Good holds to the top. To the right of the flake is the easiest line. These are approximately V2-, V0, and Veasy.
content.protection: Flat but sloping landing. It is high, so 1-2 pads.

climbs.name: Oval Boulder on East Side, aka the Trashcan

content.description: Start low and left utilizing only this boulder. climb up crimps and slopers to top out.
content.location: This is on the middle to east side of island. You can see Hidden Beach in the background of the below beta picture.

content.description: Local test piece. Stout overhanging granite. Start on obvious crimp. Move out to lip and top out.
content.location: This is at far NW side of island.

climbs.name: Joe’s Roof Area - Pocket Boulder, aka Slap the Dough

content.description: Depending on season, might have water under it. Start on two small holds with a high foot, and make big move to an awesome two finger pocket. Move up and top out.
content.location: Looking at Joe’s, it is to the right.

climbs.name: Joe’s Roof Area - lowball Boulder to SE

content.description: Short but fun moves. Start low on blocky sidepull feature. Move out to arete and up.
content.location: If looking at Joe’s Roof, it is directly behind you.

climbs.name: Joe’s Roof Area - Boulder to SW - Right face

content.description: SDS with left hand on crimp and right hand on small side pull. Work your way up on crimps and side pulls. Top out and walk down slab.
content.location: Right next to Joe’s Roof.

climbs.name: Joe’s Roof Area - Boulder to SW

content.description: SDS with left hand low in side pull and right hand on side pull. Move up crimps and sidepulls to top out.
content.location: If looking at Joe’s Roof, at climbers left.

content.description: One of the most aesthetic problems in MQT. It is slightly less than vert. Start on obvious crimp edge. Move up thin crimps to top. LZ is complex and needs 3-4 pads to make for a good landing zone.
content.location: Right next to Joe’s Roof on NW side of island.

climbs.name: Highball Slab Boulder - north arete, aka The Prow

content.description: SDS. Start with right hand low on blocky side pull and left had on small side pull. Move up arete using corner and face holds. Finish at ledge and traverse right to escape.
content.location: On the Highball slab. Side facing lake.

content.description: On the east side, there are several good lines for deep water boulder problems. There are at least 5-6 distinct lines in this area. Depending on how wet hands, shoes, and holds are, most are in the V0-V3 range.
content.protection: Water landing. Plenty deep enough. Be aware of cold water and the risks it creates. There is an easy swim out climb out 10 feet away.
content.location: On the North East end of island. Look for area in below pictures.

content.description: This is the old rock the climbs are on the 3rd stair from the top and start in horizontal holds
Start in water or off SUP on good edge. Work up the blocky side pull / pinch. Make big move to edge and top out.
content.location: NE side island

content.description: Start the same as previous problem but exit through crack for easier topout.
content.location: NE end of island

climbs.name: Deep Water Solo 2 - “Is it Deep Enough”

content.description: Start on dry pedestal to left of face. Traverse traverse right and go straight up. Crux is mantling the top out.
content.location: On NE end of island

content.description: High ball finger to hands crack. Flakey/Blocky is on the face to the right.
Start low on left side. Work way up thing crimps and arete to top out of view of Wetmore/Hidden Beach areas.
content.location: In the center of the north end. Should be able to locate by the below picture.

content.description: Start on low ledge and work your way up good face holds and sidepulls. Tall and heady but not very difficult.
content.protection: More pads the better give the height.
content.location: On North end of island. Pretty obvious boulder.

content.description: Sit start on two pad ledge on left side. Move out to right arete and then up. Top out.
content.location: Between Joe’s Roof and Pinnacle Boulder.

content.description: Start at the obvious jug and climb crimps to the top. This also makes a fun dyno from the start to the lip.
content.location: Between Pinnacle boulder and Joe’s Roof.

content.description: Sit start at base of crack. Follow crack to top and top out.
content.location: Between Joe’s and the Pinnacle Boulder.

climbs.name: The Birthplace of Fred and George

content.description: Easy slab. There are two possible routes on this boulder, one that follows a slight bump up to the right, and one that goes to the left. The one on the left starts with two underclings on two ridges, about arms length apart.
content.location: Wade out to Little Presque Isle, and take the trail that heads along the east shoreline. Descend down the first rocky section you come to that is made of granite, and the boulder will be on the left, across a small gap from the bay boulder.

content.description: This boulder is the first encounted when walking east around the point
Start on far right side on a crack/edge. Move up arete and top out.
content.protection: Need a couple pads to cover a big crevasse.
content.location: NW side of island.

content.description: This island is a local favorite for cliff jumping bouldring and ice climbing.  the rock on the island is suposed to be some of the oldest exposed on earth.
